Miss Myranda Here!
This week’s weekly PT game is Balloon Volley Ball!
All you will need for this game is an open space and a balloon (if you do not have a balloon you can substitute a ball or even a small pillow)
You can make a volleyball net just by using tape! You can place it on the ground or tape between 2 chairs to make the net higher and more difficult!
You hit the balloon back and forth until the balloon touches the ground and the other team then gets a point!
You can add some balancing/strengthening tasks to make it harder
- You can only hit the balloon over the net if you are standing on one leg
- You can only hit the balloon over the net if you jump up before you hit it
- You must hit the balloon over the net from a crab walk position
You can add an exercise to it
- If the other player scores you must do 5 sit ups
- If the other player scores you must do 5 jumping jacks
More balloon games to come!

Here is our weekly physical therapy game from our physical therapist, Miss Myranda:

With the weather this week being a little rainier I decided to choose a game that can be played inside but still involve physical activity!

Playing Card Fitness with GO FISH!
For this activity all you will need is a deck of playing cards!
You will deal out the cards just like you are playing GO FISH, each player gets 7 cards
You pair up your matches and then begin the game! If a player must “go fish” since the other player did not have the card they ask for, they choose a card out of the pile. Depending on the card they draw they must complete that exercise that matches that specific number!

Example: If I must go fish and I draw a 3 I must do mountain climbers.
If they player draws the card that they ask for then the other player must do the exercise
Example: If I ask for a K but must go fish and I draw a king from the pile the other player must complete 4 burpees!

Have fun, stay active, and stay home!

Here’s another fun activity that will help your child work on their gross motor skills from Myranda, our Physical Therapist: The Tape Shape Game!

You use tape to make different shapes on the floor, you can also use numbers or letters (or math facts for older kids) so this can double as a learning activity!

Have the child start on their favorite number, letter, or shape Then give them directions to make it from one letter/shape/number to another. An example would be “crab walk to the circle” or “frog jump to the letter A.”
Other ideas:
-bunny hop
-bear crawl
-gallop
-skip
-army crawl

This game can also be made harder by having them hold a sustained posture or do an exercise when they get to the intended shape/letter/number. For example “skip to the number 2 and then stand on 1 leg until I say stop!”

This can also be combined with other games like musical chairs, twister or simon says if there is more than 1 child playing! Be creative and stay active!

Miss Myranda, our physical therapist, has found a fun activity to help strengthen gross motor skills while having fun - a string scavenger hunt!

For this activity all you need is string or yarn. You take the string and tie it to different objects around your house, make sure you are doing different heights! The child then is on the hunt for some sort of object (this is where you can get creative) some ideas would be objects of a certain color, a certain texture, or a specific object in general. The child then has to climb over or crawl under the string and find the objects.

This works on balance, body coordination, and overall gross motor movements. You can increase the difficulty by making the child jump over the string or crab walk under the string to further engage leg and core muscles!

https://handsonaswegrow.com/activity-indoor-string-scavenger-hunt/

Artic Adventure Book Fair!

The Scholastic Book Fair returns! Students can visit the fair in the auditorium foyer anytime during the school day between December 2nd – December 6th, to purchase books. On December 5, the book fair will be available for students and family members to visit after school up to the K-6th Winter Concert beginning at 6:00pm.

Additionally, parents may visit the book fair during regular school hours by entering through this year’s main door and signing in at the main office. There are hundreds of books for all school ages, as well as fun reading and writing items to choose from.

See you at the fair!
